article:
code: 1jce) in cartoon representation. The fold of the protein is similar to
 its eukaryotic counterpart actin.]] 'MreB' is a protein found in bacteria that
 has been identified as a homologue of actin, as indicated by similarities in
 tertiary structure and conservation of active site peptide sequence. The
 conservation of protein structure suggests the common ancestry of the
 cytoskeletal elements formed by actin, found in eukaryotes, and MreB, found in
 prokaryotes. Indeed, recent studies have found that MreB proteins polymerize to
 form filaments that are similar to actin microfilaments.
